texts.definition: Gameplay where players or teams are actively trying to eliminate each other to be the last survivor.
markups: <style="Definition">Gameplay where players or teams are actively trying to eliminate each other to be the last survivor.</style>

Many games, or parts of games, pitch players against each other. When the competition between them is resolved by eliminating the others, the games have a <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> pattern.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Go">Go</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Diplomacy">Diplomacy</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/King%20of%20Tokyo">King of Tokyo</link></style> are all examples of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> with gameplay focused upon <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style>. Likewise, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Card%20Games">Card Games</link></style> <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearthstone">Hearthstone</link></style> use the pattern.

Death-match instances in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom series</link></style> provide a computer-based example. The <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike series</link></style> is this also, but in addition an example of Team-based <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> situations, except that it is a weak example since teams can also win by detonating or defusing the bomb.

<style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> requires that players can <style="Link"><link="eliminate">Eliminate</link></style> each other in game instances or particular phases of gameplay, i.e. that they have <style="Link"><link="symmetric-goals">Symmetric Goals</link></style> regarding this. <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> together with <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style> is one design solution for the former while making nearly any type of goals for players into <style="Link"><link="incompatible-goals">Incompatible Goals</link></style> vis-Ã -vis all other players work for the latter. <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> is a simple structure for creating <style="Link"><link="tournaments">Tournaments</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> can be modulated by <style="Link"><link="surrendering">Surrendering</link></style>, and game designer may want to support the <style="Link"><link="possibility-graceful-surrender">Possibility of Graceful Surrender</link></style>. While the elimination in <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> is typically focused upon individual players, it can also be applied to <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>, making it cause <style="Link"><link="tvt">TvT</link></style> gameplay.

The primary effects of <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> is to create <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style> among players as they try to both <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="overcome">Overcome</link></style> the others. These goals are <style="Link"><link="symmetric-goals">Symmetric</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="interferable-goals">Interferable Goals</link></style> since all players are trying to <style="Link"><link="eliminate">Eliminate</link></style> each other and doing so affects each others' goals. <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> can cause players may create <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Temporary%20Alliances">Temporary Alliances</link></style> to get local benefits in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> between themselves, specifically including engaging in <style="Link"><link="beat-leader">Beat the Leader</link></style> actions. Players' efforts to <style="Link"><link="eliminate">Eliminate</link></style> other players can be seen as they trying to create <style="Link"><link="collections">Collections</link></style> of beaten opponents.

<style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> provides a form of <style="Link"><link="winning-ending-gameplay">Winning by Ending Gameplay</link></style> since at least the type of actions that remove other players from the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> becomes irrelevant for that purpose when there is a sole player left. Since each player removed from the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> clearly is a closure and points towards the next closure being more important, the pattern supports <style="Link"><link="higher-level-closures-gameplay-progresses">Higher-Level Closures as Gameplay Progresses</link></style>. Since players are incrementally excluded from <style="CurrentLink">Last Man Standing</style> struggles, the pattern causes <style="Link"><link="early-elimination">Early Elimination</link></style> among the players. This, and that the pattern causes <style="Link"><link="winning-ending-gameplay">Winning by Ending Gameplay</link></style> tends to make gameplay phases with it into <style="Link"><link="endgame">Endgame</link></style> phases.
